question.body: Which of the following inorganic molecule is correctly matched with its function?

multiple_choice.choice: Calcium ions - needed for blood clotting
Fluoride - used for energy formation in the body

response.feedback: Correct. Calcium is needed not just for strong bones but for blood clotting and nerve impulses.
Incorrect. Phosphorus is needed for DNA and ATP formation and is not part of proteins.
Incorrect. Hydroxyapatite adds to the compressive strength of the bone.
Incorrect. Fluoride also adds to the strength of the bone matrix.
